intro: Waltheria madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture. Waltheria madagascariensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat.
